Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.search

Class Planner<A extends Action>

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.search.Planner<A>
Type Parameters:
A - the type of action used in solution plans this planner's searches produce
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProgressionPlanner
public abstract class Planner<A extends Action> extends Object implements Serializable
A planner is a configurable factory object for producing searches that solve planning problems by generating plans. A planner assumes that the space of possible solutions can be represented as a graph such that counting the numbers of nodes visited and generated by the search is a meaningful way to measure the amount of work done by the planner. Different planning approaches may vary in what they define as a node and how much work is required to visit or generate a node.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getSearchLimit

      public long getSearchLimit()
      Returns the maximum number of nodes that a search may visit when searching for a solution. Visiting a node generally means considering it and expanding its children nodes, if any. The constant UNLIMITED_NODES indicates no limit on how many nodes may be visited.
      Returns:
      the max number of nodes to visit

    • setSearchLimit

      public void setSearchLimit(long limit)
      Sets the maximum number of nodes that a search may visit when searching for a solution. Visiting a node generally means considering it and expanding its children nodes, if any. The constant UNLIMITED_NODES may be used to impose no limit on how many nodes may be visited.
      Parameters:
      limit - the new max number of nodes to visit

    • getSpaceLimit

      public long getSpaceLimit()
      Returns the maximum number of nodes that a search may generate while searching for a solution. The number of generated nodes counts all nodes ever created during the search for any purpose, regardless of whether they were ever visited. The constant UNLIMITED_NODES indicates no limit on how many nodes may be generated.
      Returns:
      the max number of nodes to generate

    • setSpaceLimit

      public void setSpaceLimit(long limit)
      Sets the maximum number of nodes that a search may generate while searching for a solution. The number of generated nodes counts all nodes ever created during the search for any purpose, regardless of whether they were ever visited. The constant UNLIMITED_NODES may be used to impose no limit on how many nodes may be generated.
      Parameters:
      limit - the new max number of nodes to generate

    • getTimeLimit

      public long getTimeLimit()
      Returns the maximum number of milliseconds which may elapse while searching for a solution. The constant UNLIMITED_TIME indicates no limit on the amount of time that may be taken.
      Returns:
      the max number of milliseconds to search

    • setTimeLimit

      public void setTimeLimit(long limit)
      Sets the maximum number of milliseconds which may elapse while searching for a solution. The constant UNLIMITED_TIME may be used to impose no limit on the amount of time that may be taken.
      Parameters:
      limit - the new max number of milliseconds to search

    • getAuthorTemporalLimit

      public int getAuthorTemporalLimit()
      Returns the author temporal limit for any searches created by this planner. The constant UNLIMITED_DEPTH represents no limit.
      Returns:
      the author temporal limit, or UNLIMITED_DEPTH if there is no limit

    • setAuthorTemporalLimit

      public void setAuthorTemporalLimit(int limit)
      Sets the author temporal limit for any searches created by this planner. The constant UNLIMITED_DEPTH represents no limit.
      Parameters:
      limit - the author temporal limit, or UNLIMITED_DEPTH if there should be no limit

    • getCharacterTemporalLimit

      public int getCharacterTemporalLimit()

      Returns:
      the character temporal limit, or UNLIMITED_DEPTH if there is no limit

      Parameters:
      limit - the character temporal limit, or UNLIMITED_DEPTH if there should be no limit

    • getEpistemicLimit

      public int getEpistemicLimit()

      the epistemic limit, or UNLIMITED_DEPTH if there is no limit

    • compile

      public Problem compile(Problem problem, Worker.Status status)
      Pre-processes a problem in preparation for creating a search to solve that problem.

      By default, this method returns the problem with no modifications.

      Parameters:
      problem - the problem to pre-process
      status - a status to update during the pre-processing
      Returns:
      the pre-processed problem, or the original problem is not pre-processing needs to be done

    • getSearch

      public abstract Search<A> getSearch(Problem problem, Worker.Status status)
      This is the main factory method of a planner which takes as input a planning problem and returns a search object for that problem which is configured based on this planner's current settings. This method may take a significant amount of time if the planner needs to compile the problem or any auxiliary tools for solving the problem. Before returning the search object, this method should call Search.setStart(edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.State) and Search.setGoal(edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.Number) appropriate default values.
      Parameters:
      problem - the planning problem to be solved
      status - a status object to update while compiling the problem and preparing the search object
      Returns:
      the search object
